ReviewList.Text: I thoroughly enjoyed Free Agent by J.C. Nelson. I was kept spell bound by the rich, if sometimes mind bending world she had created. The heroine, Marissa, is a tough as nails, no nonsense character who attracts disaster like it's going out of fashion. The secondary characters were intriguing and I hope are fleshed out more in further novels. Would recommend this to any fan of the urban fairy tale genre.

I read through 10 percent of this story and could not read any further. Three times within that short period of time, the reference to hurting animals (even if this is a work of fiction and meant to be funny) bothered me to the point I had to stop reading.  Perhaps it's just me and I don't understand the author's humorous voice. The characters are cute, great story line.  But....Sorry. It's just not my cup of tea.
The voice was really witty and entertaining. The characters were diverse. The plot was fast paced and kept me guessing. A really fun read.

This is a new take on Grimm.  Here he is a Fairy Godfather and he can grant wishes for a price.  Marissa Locks is one of his agents as a result of one of those wishes.  Her parents sold her to Grimm In return for her sisters health. There is quite a bit of world building and character development required for Free Agent.  All of that is done as a part of story line.  The plot is complicated and the results sometimes surprising.  It is a good story to set  up the series.  Many things are solved in Free Agent and with the solutions come the hooks for future stories featuring Grimm and Marissa.

A fresh new voice in urban fantasy. It's been a while since I read a book back to back. Well-developed characters, interesting world building and a sassy heroine.  Very enjoyable! Can't wait until next book in the series.
This author not only has a way with words but dang she can twist a tale to hook you and reel you in.  This modern urban fairy tale was so dang good I will never look at another one the same way!
This is a good book for  young adults. Good versus evil. The characters are easy to like and easy to hate. I look forward to more books from this author
I really like this series and find it refreshing. I also really hate it when they make you review a good book with a word limit.
If you enjoy a different spin on the old faery tales, police work and hard won friendships....this is the ticket to that realm.
J. C. Nelson is new to me. I'm going to be watching this author's story telling progress!

I learned about this book from one of my online groups. This was a great read! Already looking forward to the next one in the series. I love the mix of traditional fairy tale elements with the modern world. The book moved quickly and kept me wanting to know more about the characters.
I loved it can't wait for the next one ..
I really enjoyed the characters in Free Agent. From the man in the mirror to the hellhound that liked to eat poodles, they were all fun to get to know. Can't wait for the next book.
This was both a sweet and exciting story. Can't wait for the next want to come out!

This new series has lots of elements of fairy tales merged into a chaotic world. The basic premise is detective story or problem solving agents fighting evil. The problem was too many characters and too much happening without it being really explained. It got very confusing fast. Also not much time between our heroine and her hero. This book also verges on the dark side of Faire so lots of pain and violence.

This is more of a sci-fi/fantasy book than romance. It has that somewhat obscure writing style more often found there. It's not a bad book. I read thru it and I think there will be any number of people that will like it but it just didn't appeal to me. The blurb in the back for the next book appealed less.
Very different and very confusing,,,Has am interesting plot line but I could not connect the dots all the  time.  To each his own on this one.
